page.title: 07The River Tern
page.content: The Tern flows West along the Southern edge of the area.Its steep sided valley,a major feature of the area,has proved to be a natural barrier to the development of the town.Routes up from the valley are steep, notably Kiln Bank and Red Bank .Phoenix Bank, carrying the A529 after it has crossed the Tern, is the major route.There are two other bridging points, the Sutton Road crosses it at Walkmill and Buntingsdale Road crosses it in the West. The Tern has also been useful.It has powered two mills in the area. Neither of these operate today.The mill at Walkmill is only a derelict site.The house and mill at Tern house adjacent to the A529 still stand but the machinery is long gone. The open swimming pool is heated by the Tern using heat exchange equipment.The sewage farm discharges into the river.
